articles.headline: Obama, at Convention, Lays Out Stakes for a Divided Nation
articles.snippet: The president revisited his own promise to guide the country into a new age of unity as a framework to rally Democrats around Hillary Clinton.
articles.abstract: The president revisited his own promise to guide the country into a new age of unity as a framework to rally Democrats around Hillary Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — Follow along with our coverage of the Democratic National Convention.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Beetles Do Beatles: Music Coup for an Animated Netflix Show
articles.snippet: “Beat Bugs” a children’s show, is one of several shows whose creator uses licensing deals to feature iconic song collections in unusually extensive ways.
articles.abstract: “Beat Bugs” a children’s show, is one of several shows whose creator uses licensing deals to feature iconic song collections in unusually extensive ways.
articles.lead_paragraph: If Josh Wakely was feeling a little fried, it was understandable: He had quickly become one of the busiest young writers and producers in television — with a little help from the Beatles, Bob Dylan and Motown.

articles.headline: A Stony Silence at Fox News After Ailes’s Departure
articles.snippet: Some Fox News employees say there is an internal split inside the network, pitting those who support Roger Ailes against those who do not.
articles.abstract: Some Fox News employees say there is an internal split inside the network, pitting those who support Roger Ailes against those who do not.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — The Fox News skybox here turns into a hive of activity as the network’s star anchors analyze the Democratic National Convention for millions of viewers.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and Emily Steel

articles.headline: After Years of Setbacks, Democrats Again See Gun Control as a Winning Issue
articles.snippet: Mass shootings involving high-powered weapons, rising anxiety about domestic terrorism, and killings of and by police officers have emboldened the party.
articles.abstract: Mass shootings involving high-powered weapons, rising anxiety about domestic terrorism, and killings of and by police officers have emboldened the party.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — Follow along with our coverage of the Democratic National Convention.

articles.headline: Clinton’s Convention Was Made for TV. Trump’s Was Made for Twitter.
articles.snippet: The Democrats’ polished convention stands in contrast to the Republicans’ free-for-all. But Donald Trump has gotten where he is by defying the traditional media rules.
articles.abstract: The Democrats’ polished convention stands in contrast to the Republicans’ free-for-all. But Donald Trump has gotten where he is by defying the traditional media rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — Hillary Clinton put on a better television show in Philadelphia than Donald J. Trump did in Cleveland.

articles.headline: Championing Optimism, Obama Hails Clinton as His Political Heir
articles.snippet: President Obama defended his legacy and laid out the ways Hillary Clinton would continue it at the Democratic National Convention on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: President Obama defended his legacy and laid out the ways Hillary Clinton would continue it at the Democratic National Convention on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — President Obama delivered a stirring valedictory address at the Democratic convention Wednesday night, hailing Hillary Clinton as his rightful political heir and the party’s best hope to protect democracy from “homegrown demagogues” like the Republican Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Debt Collectors’ Abuses Prompt Consumer Agency to Propose New Rules
articles.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau proposals aim to strengthen federal efforts to clamp down on collectors who hound people for debts they may not owe.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau proposals aim to strengthen federal efforts to clamp down on collectors who hound people for debts they may not owe.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the first time in nearly 40 years, federal regulators are preparing to significantly strengthen the rules that govern debt collection in an effort to clamp down on collectors who hound consumers for debts they may not even owe.

articles.headline: After Lying Low, Deep-Pocketed Clinton Donors Return to the Fore
articles.snippet: As protesters bashed big money and Wall Street, the Democratic Party’s moneyed elite gathered in Philadelphia, undeterred and mostly unabashed.
articles.abstract: As protesters bashed big money and Wall Street, the Democratic Party’s moneyed elite gathered in Philadelphia, undeterred and mostly unabashed.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — In a luxury suite high above the convention floor, some of the Democratic Party’s most generous patrons sipped cocktails and caught up with old friends, tuning out Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont on Monday as he bashed Wall Street in an arena named after one of the country’s largest banks.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore and Amy Chozick

articles.headline: Oracle’s $9.3 Billion Deal for NetSuite Will Bolster Its Cloud Offerings
articles.snippet: The deal, among the largest in Oracle’s history, is at the heart of the company’s fight to remake itself for the modern world of cloud computing.
articles.abstract: The deal, among the largest in Oracle’s history, is at the heart of the company’s fight to remake itself for the modern world of cloud computing.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Evan M. Goldberg founded NetSuite in 1998, he did so with backing from his former boss, Lawrence J. Ellison, who started the software giant Oracle.
articles.byline: By Quentin Hardy and Leslie Picker
